question: 安い
sourceMnemonic: This is a single kanji with an <ja>い</ja> at the end, meaning you know it's probably an adjective. One of the meanings of <ja>安</ja> is <kanji>cheap</kanji>, so this is just that as an adjective, <vocabulary>cheap</vocabulary>. Time to go to a 100<ja>円</ja> shop and get some <ja>安い</ja> goods, ammiright?
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

"Would you like this item for <vocabulary>cheap</vocabulary>?" 

"Uh, <reading>yes</reading> (<ja>やす</ja>) please!"
